tours.title: 8 Days Culture, Wildlife and Heritage of Nepal
tours.description: A Journey Through Nepal’s Living Heritage, Timeless Temples, and Breathtaking LandscapesOverview of JourneyIf you are dreaming of a once-in-a-lifetime...

activities.name: Cultural Tours
activities.description: Experience cultural activities

itinerary.title: Day 1
itinerary.description:
: Day 1: Welcome to Kathmandu (1,400m)
                                                        
                                                    
                                                    
                                                        
                                                            Arrive at Tribhuvan International Airport where our representative welcomes guests with a traditional Tika and flower garland. After a comfortable transfer and hotel check-in, guests have some time to relax. In the evening, enjoy a welcome dinner at a heritage-style restaurant, featuring authentic Nepali cuisine and a classical live cultural dance performance, introducing Nepal’s rich artistic traditions.Dinner at Hotel.

itinerary.title: Day 02
itinerary.description:
: UNESCO Heritage Sites of Kathmandu
                                                        
                                                    
                                                    
                                                        
                                                            After breakfast, explore Kathmandu’s key UNESCO World Heritage Sites. Visit Swayambhunath Stupa (Monkey Temple), a 2,000-year-old Buddhist shrine with stunning valley views. Proceed to Pashupatinath Temple, the sacred Hindu temple on the banks of the Bagmati River. Then, walk around the serene Boudhanath Stupa, a major center for Tibetan Buddhism. In the afternoon, explore Kathmandu Durbar Square, once the royal palace, where guests can see intricately carved temples, courtyards, and the Kumari Ghar (home of the Living Goddess).  Dinner at Hotel.

itinerary.title: Day 03
itinerary.description:
: Kathmandu to Chitwan – Tharu Culture Experience
                                                        
                                                    
                                                    
                                                        
                                                            Depart from Kathmandu to Pokhara by flight after breakfast in the morning. Upon arrival, guests are welcomed with drinks and settle into a comfortable resort. In the late afternoon, explore a nearby Tharu village and visit the Tharu Cultural Museum to learn about their indigenous lifestyle and history. In the evening, canoeing at Rapti river then a tharu stick dance performance, showcasing unique traditions of this ethnic group. Dinner is served at the resort.

itinerary.title: Day 04
itinerary.description:
: Chitwan to Pokhara – Journey to the Lake City
                                                        
                                                    
                                                    
                                                        
                                                            After breakfast, enjoy jeep safari at Chitwan National park. Take a flight from Bharatpur airport. Welcome to a picturesque city famous for its natural beauty and Himalayan views. Upon arrival, check in at a lakeside hotel. In the evening, enjoy a serene boat ride on Phewa Lake and visit the Tal Barahi Temple on the lake’s island, a place of local spiritual importance. Rest of the evening is free to enjoy the lakeside ambience. Dinner at Hotel

itinerary.title: Day 05
itinerary.description:
: Pokhara Sightseeing – Culture, Spirituality and transfer to Ghandruk
                                                        
                                                    
                                                    
                                                        
                                                            Optional early morning drive to Sarangkot to witness sunrise over the Annapurna and Machhapuchhre (Fishtail) mountains. Return for breakfast and begin a full-day Pokhara tour: visit the International Mountain Museum, explore Bindhyabasini Temple, and the sacred Gupteshwor Cave with nearby Devi's Fall. Drive toward Ghandruk. Reach in the evening and enjoy traditional Gurung Culture with cultural food. Enjoy music and traditional instruments. Dinner at local homestay.

itinerary.title: Day 06
itinerary.description:
: Return to Kathmandu
                                                        
                                                    
                                                    
                                                        
                                                            After Breakfast,  return back to Pokhara then fly Kathmandu in the m (25-min flight). After check-in, the afternoon is free for personal activities—shopping in Thamel, local cafés, or optional spa sessions. Dinner at a Hotel.

itinerary.title: Day 07
itinerary.description:
: Patan and Bhaktapur – Living Art & Architecture
                                                        
                                                    
                                                    
                                                        
                                                            Today, travel to the ancient city of Patan (Lalitpur) to explore Patan Durbar Square, known for its magnificent stone and metalwork. Visit the Golden Temple, Krishna Mandir, and traditional artist workshops to witness artisans working on thangkas, metal statues, and wood carvings. Drive to Bhaktapur, a perfectly preserved medieval city, famous for its 55-Window Palace, Nyatapola Temple, and Pottery Square, where guests can try hands-on pottery-making with local artisans. Return to Kathmandu in the evening.

itinerary.title: Day 08
itinerary.description:
: Departure from Kathmandu
                                                        
                                                    
                                                    
                                                        
                                                            After breakfast, transfer to the international airport for final departure. Guests receive a small handcrafted souvenir as a keepsake of their unforgettable Nepal experience.

tours.fitness_requirements: Good physical fitness required.

booking_info.cancellation_policy: Free cancellation up to 7 days before departure

tours.title: Annapurna Base Camp Trek - 12 Nights 13 Days
tours.description: Embark on one of Nepal's most spectacular trekking adventures to Annapurna Base Camp, situated in the heart of the Annapurna Sanctuary. This incredible journey takes you through diverse landscapes from subtropical forests to alpine meadows, culminating at the base camp surrounded by towering peaks including Annapurna I (8,091m), Machapuchare (6,993m), and Hiunchuli (6,441m). Experience the rich culture of Gurung and Magar communities, soak in natural hot springs, and witness breathtaking sunrise views over the Annapurna massif.
highlights: Natural hot springs at Jhinu Danda
inclusions: First aid kit and oxygen meter

activities.name: High Altitude Trekking
activities.description: Trek through diverse ecosystems from tropical to alpine zones

activities.name: Cultural Immersion
activities.description: Experience Gurung and Magar village life and traditions

activities.name: Natural Hot Springs
activities.description: Relax in therapeutic hot springs at Jhinu Danda

activities.name: Wildlife Observation
activities.description: Spot Himalayan wildlife in the Annapurna Conservation Area

itinerary.title: Arrival in Kathmandu (1,400m)sssss
itinerary.description: Welcome to Nepal! Upon arrival at Tribhuvan International Airport, our representative will meet you and transfer you to your hotel in Kathmandu. After check-in, attend a comprehensive pre-trek briefing where you'll meet your trekking guide and receive detailed information about the Annapurna Base Camp trek. Equipment check and final preparations. Evening welcome dinner featuring traditional Nepali cuisine and cultural performances. Overnight in Kathmandu.

itinerary.title: Drive to Pokhara (822m)
itinerary.description: After breakfast, embark on a scenic 6-7 hour drive to Pokhara through winding mountain roads, terraced fields, and traditional villages. The journey offers glimpses of rural Nepali life and changing landscapes. Alternatively, take a 25-minute domestic flight for spectacular aerial views of the Himalayas. Upon arrival in Pokhara, check into lakeside hotel and enjoy the serene atmosphere of Phewa Lake. Evening free to explore the vibrant Lakeside area with its restaurants, cafes, and shops. Final trek preparations and equipment check.

itinerary.title: Drive to Nayapul & Trek to Tikhedhunga (1,577m)
itinerary.description: Early morning drive to Nayapul (1,070m), the starting point of your Annapurna Base Camp trek. Begin trekking along the Modi Khola river through beautiful countryside and traditional villages. Cross suspension bridges and pass through Birethanti, where you'll complete permit formalities. The trail gradually ascends through terraced fields and small settlements. Arrive at Tikhedhunga, a small village with teahouses offering basic but comfortable accommodation. Trek duration: 4-5 hours. Overnight in teahouse.

itinerary.title: Trek to Ghorepani (2,874m)
itinerary.description: Today involves a challenging climb up the famous stone steps to Ulleri village, followed by a gradual ascent through beautiful rhododendron and oak forests. The trail offers occasional glimpses of Annapurna South and Hiunchuli peaks. Pass through several small villages and experience the hospitality of local Magar and Gurung communities. Arrive at Ghorepani, a popular trekking hub with stunning mountain views. The village name means 'horse water,' reflecting its historical importance as a trading route. Trek duration: 6-7 hours. Overnight in teahouse.

itinerary.title: Poon Hill Sunrise & Trek to Tadapani (2,630m)
itinerary.description: Pre-dawn hike to Poon Hill (3,210m), one of the most famous viewpoints in the Himalayas. Watch the spectacular sunrise illuminate the Annapurna and Dhaulagiri mountain ranges, including Annapurna I, Annapurna South, Machapuchare, Dhaulagiri, and many other peaks. The panoramic 360-degree views are absolutely breathtaking. Return to Ghorepani for breakfast, then continue trekking through dense rhododendron forests (spectacular in spring) to Tadapani. The trail offers beautiful mountain views and diverse flora. Trek duration: 6-7 hours including Poon Hill. Overnight in teahouse.

itinerary.title: Trek to Sinuwa (2,360m)
itinerary.description: Descend through beautiful forests with occasional clearings offering mountain views. The trail passes through Banthanti and continues through dense rhododendron and bamboo forests. Cross several streams and enjoy the changing vegetation as you descend. The path can be muddy and slippery during monsoon season, requiring careful footing. Arrive at Sinuwa, a small settlement with basic teahouse facilities. The village offers good views of Machapuchare and Annapurna South. Trek duration: 5-6 hours. Overnight in teahouse.

itinerary.title: Trek to Deurali (3,230m)
itinerary.description: Continue ascending through the Modi Khola valley with increasingly spectacular mountain views. Pass through Chhomrong, a large Gurung village with excellent mountain views and the last permanent settlement before entering the Annapurna Sanctuary. Cross the Chhomrong Khola on a suspension bridge and climb steeply up stone steps. The trail then descends to Bamboo and continues through dense bamboo and rhododendron forests to Deurali. The landscape becomes more alpine as you gain altitude. Trek duration: 6-7 hours. Overnight in teahouse.

itinerary.title: Trek to Annapurna Base Camp (4,130m)
itinerary.description: The ultimate day! Early start for the final push to Annapurna Base Camp. Pass through Machapuchare Base Camp (3,700m) with stunning close-up views of the sacred Machapuchare peak. Continue ascending through the glacial valley into the heart of the Annapurna Sanctuary. The landscape becomes increasingly dramatic with towering peaks surrounding you on all sides. Reach Annapurna Base Camp, situated in a natural amphitheater surrounded by some of the world's highest peaks. Celebrate this incredible achievement and take in the surreal 360-degree mountain panorama. Trek duration: 5-6 hours. Overnight in teahouse.

itinerary.title: Sunrise at ABC & Trek to Bamboo (2,310m)
itinerary.description: Wake up early to witness one of the world's most spectacular sunrises as the first rays of light illuminate the surrounding peaks including Annapurna I, Annapurna South, Machapuchare, Hiunchuli, and Gangapurna. The golden glow on the snow-capped peaks is absolutely magical. After breakfast and final photos, begin the descent retracing your steps through Machapuchare Base Camp and Deurali to Bamboo. The long descent requires careful attention to footing. Trek duration: 7-8 hours. Overnight in teahouse.

itinerary.title: Trek to Jhinu Danda (1,780m)
itinerary.description: Continue descending through the Modi Khola valley, passing through Sinuwa and Chhomrong. The trail offers different perspectives of the mountains you've just visited. Arrive at Jhinu Danda, famous for its natural hot springs. After checking into the teahouse, take a 20-minute walk down to the hot springs located beside the Modi Khola river. Soak your tired muscles in the therapeutic hot water while enjoying views of the surrounding hills. This is a perfect way to relax after days of challenging trekking. Trek duration: 6-7 hours. Overnight in teahouse.

itinerary.title: Trek to Nayapul & Drive to Pokhara
itinerary.description: Final trekking day descending through familiar territory with a sense of accomplishment. Pass through traditional villages, terraced fields, and cross suspension bridges over rushing rivers. Reflect on your incredible journey and the memories created in the Annapurna Sanctuary. Arrive at Nayapul where your trek officially ends. Drive back to Pokhara and check into your lakeside hotel. Celebrate your successful Annapurna Base Camp trek with your team. Evening free for shopping, spa treatments, or simply relaxing by Phewa Lake. Trek duration: 5-6 hours. Overnight in Pokhara.

itinerary.title: Return to Kathmandu
itinerary.description: Morning flight or drive back to Kathmandu depending on your preference and weather conditions. The flight offers spectacular aerial views of the mountains you've just trekked to, providing a different perspective of your achievement. Upon arrival in Kathmandu, transfer to your hotel and enjoy a hot shower and comfortable bed. Afternoon free for shopping in Thamel, spa treatments, or exploring additional sights in Kathmandu. Evening celebration dinner with cultural show featuring traditional Nepali music and dance. Receive your trek completion certificate. Overnight in Kathmandu.

itinerary.title: Departure
itinerary.description: Final day in Nepal. Depending on your flight schedule, enjoy some last-minute shopping in Thamel for trekking gear, handicrafts, or souvenirs. Visit additional sights in Kathmandu if time permits. Our representative will assist with airport transfer according to your flight schedule. Depart with incredible memories of your Annapurna Base Camp adventure, the stunning mountain views, cultural experiences, and a tremendous sense of personal achievement that will last a lifetime.

tours.fitness_requirements: Good physical fitness required. Regular cardio training and hiking experience recommended. Ability to walk 6-8 hours daily on varied terrain.

altitude_profile.difficulty_level: Moderate to Challenging - High altitude trekking

tours.title: Buddhist Pilgrimage Tour-6N/7D
tours.description: Trip OverviewOne of the most sacred on a spiritually enriching 7-day Buddhist pilgrimage across Nepal andIndia, tracing the footsteps of Lord Buddha t...

activities.name: Cultural Experience
activities.description: Experience cultural activities

itinerary.title: Day 1
itinerary.description:
: Arrival in Bhairahawa & Lumbini Exploration
                                                        
                                                    
                                                    
                                                        
                                                            Upon arrival at Bhairahawa International Airport, the group will be welcomed and transferred to
Lumbini, the birthplace of Lord Buddha. A full day of exploration includes the Sacred Garden,
Maya Devi Temple, Ashoka Pillar, World Peace Pagoda, and the International Monastic Zone,
featuring temples from various Buddhist traditions worldwide. After a serene day in Lumbini, the
group will check into a 4-star hotel for an overnight stay.
Accommodation: Nanc Hotel or Similar (4-Star)

itinerary.title: Day 2
itinerary.description:
: Kapilvastu Exploration & Transfer to Bhairahawa
                                                        
                                                    
                                                    
                                                        
                                                            After breakfast, the group will travel to Kapilvastu, the ancient kingdom of Prince Siddhartha.
The visit includes Tilaurakot, Kudan, Gotihawa, and Niglihawa, all significant locations linked to
Buddha’s early life.
Accommodation: Nanc Hotel or Similar (4-Star)

itinerary.title: Day 3
itinerary.description:
: Transfer to Sunauli Border & Travel to Bodhgaya
                                                        
                                                    
                                                    
                                                        
                                                            The journey to India begins with an early morning border crossing at Sunauli. From Gorakhpur,
the group will board a train to Gaya, followed by a road transfer to Bodhgaya, a journey of about
8-9 hours. Upon arrival, they will check into their 3-star hotel and rest overnight.
Accommodation: 3-Star Hotel in Bodhgaya

itinerary.title: Day 4
itinerary.description:
: Bodhgaya Sightseeing
                                                        
                                                    
                                                    
                                                        
                                                            A full day of spiritual exploration in Bodhgaya, the place where Buddha attained enlightenment.
The group will visit the Mahabodhi Temple, Bodhi Tree, Great Buddha Statue, Thai Monastery,
Niranjana River, and Sujata Village, where Buddha received his final meal before enlightenment.
Accommodation: 3-Star Hotel in Bodhgaya

itinerary.title: Day 5
itinerary.description:
: Travel to Kushinagar
                                                        
                                                    
                                                    
                                                        
                                                            After breakfast, the group will travel 6-7 hours to Kushinagar, the site of Buddha’s
Mahaparinirvana (final enlightenment). They will visit the Mahaparinirvana Temple, Rambhar
Stupa, and Meditation Park, before checking into the hotel for an overnight stay.
Accommodation: 3-Star Hotel in Kushinagar

itinerary.title: Day 6
itinerary.description:
: Transfer to Varanasi & Sightseeing
                                                        
                                                    
                                                    
                                                        
                                                            After breakfast, the group will drive 5-6 hours to Varanasi, one of the oldest and holiest cities in
India. They will visit Sarnath, where Buddha delivered his first sermon, and explore Dhamek
Stupa, Mulagandha Kuti Vihara, and the Sarnath Museum. In the evening, they will witness the
spiritually uplifting Ganga Aarti ceremony at the ghats of the River Ganges before returning to
their hotel for the night.
Accommodation: 3-Star Hotel in Varanasi

itinerary.title: Day 7
itinerary.description:
: Departure to Gorakhpur & Return to Bhairahawa
                                                        
                                                    
                                                    
                                                        
                                                            The group will depart early in the morning from Varanasi and travel 5 hours to Gorakhpur
Railway Station. From there, they will return to Sunauli, cross the border, and be picked up by a
Nepali vehicle for the final transfer to Bhairahawa Airport, marking the end of their memorable
pilgrimage

tours.title: Chitwan Adventure & Wild Expedition – 4 Days
tours.description: Break free from the mundane and immerse yourself in an exceptional 4-day adventure that merges exhilarating white-water rafting on the mighty Trishuli River with an immersive jungle safari expedition in Chitwan National Park. This meticulously designed adventure package transports you from thundering river rapids to pristine wilderness, delivering the ideal fusion of high-octane thrills and natural discovery that adventure enthusiasts crave.
highlights: Exhilarating Trishuli River rafting with Class III rapids adventure
Wildlife encounters including rhinos, crocodiles, exotic birds, and potential tiger sightings
Unique jungle tower camping experience inside Chitwan National Park
Expert naturalist-guided wilderness walks and exploration
Scenic canoe expeditions on the pristine Rapti River
Comprehensive meal packages and all national park permits included
Cultural stop at renowned Barahsinghe Beer Factory
Riverside camping with traditional bonfire experiences
Professional rafting guides and safety equipment provided
inclusions: Accommodation for 3 nights (Day 1: riverside camp, Day 2: jungle tower camp, Day 3: Sauraha hotel)
Trishuli River white-water rafting with professional guides
All rafting safety equipment and gear
Jungle tower camping experience inside national park
Guided jungle walks with expert naturalists
All Chitwan National Park entrance fees
exclusions: Personal expenses (laundry, phone calls, shopping, etc.)
Optional Barahsinghe Beer Factory visit expenses
Extra activities not mentioned in the itinerary

itinerary.title: Kathmandu to Malekhu or Kurintar (Rafting Adventure)
itinerary.description: Morning departure from Kathmandu to Malekhu or Kurintar for an action-packed day. Enjoy a delicious riverside lunch before gearing up for an exhilarating white-water rafting expedition on the Trishuli River. Navigate exciting Class III rapids under the guidance of professional rafting instructors, experiencing the thrill of Nepal's pristine mountain waters. Evening features a traditional dinner and cozy bonfire at the riverside camp, sharing adventure stories under the starlit sky. Overnight accommodation at the scenic riverside camp.

itinerary.title: Riverside Camp to Chitwan (Jungle Tower Camping)
itinerary.description: Begin with breakfast at the riverside camp before embarking on the journey to Chitwan National Park. Upon arrival, participate in a comprehensive jungle orientation walk led by expert naturalists who will introduce you to the park's ecosystem and wildlife. Experience the unique adventure of overnight accommodation in an exclusive jungle tower camp situated inside the national park boundaries. Please bring necessary food and beverages for this wilderness experience. Enjoy dinner served in the wild, creating an authentic adventure atmosphere surrounded by jungle sounds.

itinerary.title: Jungle Canoe Expedition and Wilderness Walk
itinerary.description: Start with an early morning canoe expedition on the tranquil Rapti River, perfect for spotting marsh crocodiles and diverse water bird species in their natural habitat. Continue with an extensive guided jungle walk accompanied by experienced naturalists, venturing deeper into the park's core areas for wildlife encounters. Return to Sauraha for lunch and relaxation. Spend the evening enjoying the sunset along the Rapti riverbank while experiencing the local nightlife atmosphere. Overnight stay at a comfortable Sauraha hotel.

itinerary.title: Return to Kathmandu via Barahsinghe Beer Factory
itinerary.description: Begin the day with morning tea in the wilderness setting before starting the return journey to Kathmandu. Make an optional one-hour recreational stop at the famous Barahsinghe Beer Factory and Restaurant for relaxation, refreshments, and local cultural experience. Continue the scenic drive with an en-route lunch stop, enjoying the changing landscapes from jungle to hills. Arrive in Kathmandu by evening, carrying unforgettable memories of your combined rafting and jungle adventure expedition.

what_to_bring: Quick-dry clothing and swimwear for rafting
Light cotton clothing for jungle activities
Personal medications and first aid kit
Personal snacks and beverages for tower camp
tours.fitness_requirements: Moderate physical fitness required. Participants should be comfortable with water activities and able to walk on uneven jungle terrain. Basic swimming ability recommended for rafting safety.

wildlife_info.best_viewing_time: Early morning and late afternoon during jungle activities
wildlife_info.conservation_status: UNESCO World Heritage Site with strict conservation protocols

booking_info.advance_booking: 5-7 days recommended for rafting permits and jungle tower camp reservations
booking_info.cancellation_policy: Free cancellation up to 3 days before departure. Weather-dependent activities may be modified for safety.

good_to_know.main_attractions: Exhilarating Class III white-water rafting on Trishuli River, unique jungle tower camping experience inside Chitwan National Park, comprehensive wildlife encounters including rhinos and potential tiger sightings, peaceful canoe expeditions on Rapti River, expert-guided wilderness exploration, and cultural stop at renowned Barahsinghe Beer Factory.
good_to_know.travel_distances: Kathmandu to Malekhu/Kurintar takes 3-4 hours for rafting start point, Malekhu to Chitwan requires 2-3 hours scenic drive, all jungle activities occur within national park boundaries, and return journey to Kathmandu via Barahsinghe takes 5-6 hours with cultural stops.
good_to_know.accommodation_standards: Riverside camping with basic but comfortable facilities and bonfire experiences, exclusive elevated jungle tower camp inside national park with wilderness atmosphere, and standard Sauraha hotel with modern amenities, restaurant facilities, and convenient location for jungle activities.
good_to_know.additional_activities: Extended rafting experiences, additional wildlife safaris, photography workshops, cultural village visits, spa treatments in Sauraha, elephant breeding center tours, and extended jungle tower camping are available with advance arrangement and supplementary costs.

faqs.question: Can this adventure expedition be customized according to my preferences?
faqs.answer: Absolutely! We offer flexible customization including extended rafting sections, additional jungle tower camping nights, upgraded accommodations, extra wildlife activities, photography-focused extensions, cultural immersion experiences, or modified adventure schedules based on your thrill-seeking preferences and fitness levels.

faqs.question: What specific items are included and excluded from the package price?
faqs.answer: Included are private transportation, varied accommodations (riverside camp, jungle tower, hotel), specified meals, rafting equipment and guides, canoe expeditions, guided jungle walks, park entrance fees, and professional adventure guides. Excluded are dinners on Day 3-4, beverages, personal expenses, tips, and travel insurance.

faqs.question: What is the cancellation policy?
faqs.answer: Cancellations made 7 days before departure receive full refund (minus processing fees), 50% refund for cancellations within 3-6 days, and no refund for cancellations less than 2 days before departure. Weather-dependent activities may be modified for safety while maintaining adventure elements.

faqs.question: What is the best time for this adventure expedition?
faqs.answer: The optimal time is September to May when weather conditions are ideal for both rafting and jungle activities, river levels are perfect for Class III rapids, wildlife is most active, and comfortable temperatures make camping and outdoor adventures most enjoyable.

faqs.question: How do I book this adventure expedition?
faqs.answer: Booking is straightforward through Gomayu travel agency - contact our adventure expedition specialists for detailed activity briefings, use our secure online booking platform, or visit our office for comprehensive consultation about adventure requirements and immediate confirmation with activity reservations.

tours.title: Chitwan Wildlife & Nightlife Overland Tour – 4 Days
tours.description: Experience the best of Nepal's wildlife with our Chitwan Wildlife & Adventure Tour from Kathmandu. This comprehensive 4-day safari package has been specifically designed for travelers seeking a complete jungle adventure, delivering exceptional wildlife experiences with carefully selected activities and premium resort accommodations. Chitwan National Park, Nepal's wildlife crown jewel and UNESCO World Heritage Site, spans over 932 square kilometers of pristine subtropical wilderness, home to over 68 mammal species and 500+ bird species including one-horned rhinoceros, Royal Bengal tigers, and Asian elephants.

itinerary.title: Drive from Kathmandu to Chitwan – Scenic Journey & Leisure at Resort
itinerary.description: Early morning departure from Kathmandu by private vehicle (approximately 5–6 hours). En route, enjoy a scenic 1-hour break at Malekhu (famous for local fish dishes) or at the Barasinghe Beer Factory & Restaurant for refreshments (optional). Continue the picturesque drive along the Trishuli River and through beautiful countryside landscapes. Arrival at Chitwan with welcome drinks and resort check-in. Afternoon at leisure – relax by the pool, explore the resort garden, or simply unwind in the jungle atmosphere. Dinner and overnight stay at jungle resort.

itinerary.title: Full-Day Jungle Adventures
itinerary.description: Breakfast at the resort followed by an exciting canoe ride on Rapti River – spot crocodiles, water birds, and enjoy peaceful river views while learning about the ecosystem. Return to Sauraha for lunch and a short rest. Head out for an thrilling jeep safari inside Chitwan National Park – explore diverse grasslands, riversides, and dense forest areas while searching for one-horned rhinoceros, Royal Bengal tigers, and other wildlife. Evening leisure time to experience a beautiful sunset view by the riverbank in Sauraha or relax at the resort. Traditional Tharu cultural performance in the evening. Overnight stay.

itinerary.title: Jungle Walk & More Safari
itinerary.description: After breakfast, embark on an early morning guided jungle walk with expert naturalists to track wildlife and enjoy comprehensive birdwatching. Learn about the park's ecosystem, medicinal plants, and animal behavior from knowledgeable local guides. Explore the pristine Bis Hazari Lake, a hidden gem perfect for observing wetland wildlife and unique bird species. Return back to Sauraha and enjoy leisure time relaxing on the riverbank or at the resort. Optional activities include visiting the elephant breeding center or exploring local Tharu villages. Overnight stay at the resort.

itinerary.title: Drive Back to Kathmandu
itinerary.description: Breakfast at the resort and check-out. Begin the scenic drive back to Kathmandu through Nepal's diverse landscapes. En route, enjoy a relaxing 1-hour stop again at Malekhu or Barasinghe Beer Factory & Restaurant for snacks, refreshments, or to purchase local specialties. Continue onward through the beautiful countryside and reach Kathmandu by late afternoon/evening. Drop-off at your hotel or Tribhuvan International Airport as per your requirement, concluding your memorable wildlife adventure.

what_to_bring: Light cotton clothing in earth tones
Long-sleeved shirts and pants for jungle walks

faqs.question: Can this wildlife itinerary be customized according to my preferences?
faqs.answer: Yes! We offer flexible customization including extended stays for more wildlife viewing, upgraded resort accommodations, additional safari activities, cultural immersion experiences with Tharu communities, photography-focused tours, or modified activity schedules based on wildlife viewing preferences.

faqs.question: What specific items are included and excluded from the package price?
faqs.answer: Included are private transfers, jungle resort accommodation, specified meals, canoe rides, jeep safari, guided jungle walks, Bis Hazari Lake exploration, park entrance fees, and cultural performances. Excluded are dinners, beverages, personal expenses, tips, optional activities, and travel insurance.

faqs.question: What is the cancellation policy?
faqs.answer: Cancellations made 5 days before departure receive full refund (minus processing fees), 50% refund for cancellations within 2-4 days, and no refund for cancellations less than 1 day before departure. Weather-dependent activities may be rescheduled for optimal wildlife viewing.

faqs.question: What is the best time for wildlife viewing?
faqs.answer: The optimal time is September to May when weather is pleasant, wildlife is most active, vegetation is less dense for better animal spotting, and comfortable temperatures make jungle activities enjoyable throughout the day with excellent photography conditions.

faqs.question: How do I book this wildlife adventure?
faqs.answer: Booking is easy through Gomayu travel agency - contact our wildlife specialists for expert advice, use our secure online booking system, or visit our office for detailed consultation about wildlife viewing expectations and immediate confirmation with park permits.

tours.title: CULTURAL & HERITAGE TOUR OF NEPAL
tours.description: Highlights:“A cultural tour around Kathmandu valley visiting ancient religious sitesFascinating world heritage monuments of immense interest and livel...

activities.name: Cultural Experience
activities.description: Experience cultural activities

itinerary.title: Day 1
itinerary.description:
: Arrive in Kathmandu meet our staff and transfer to hotel.
                                                        
                                                    
                                                    
                                                        
                                                            On arrival in Kathmandu international airport via respective airlines where Guru travels staff receives you with warm welcome and then transfer to your hotel around Thamel area in the hub of Kathmandu.
Thamel an interesting place with many shops and stores and international standard restaurants including shops-stores, Guru Travel guide will brief you with details and information of the hotels and Cultural & Heritage Tour of Nepal with welcome dinner in a nice Nepali restaurant includes folk culture program.

itinerary.title: Day 2
itinerary.description:
: Tour of Kathmandu around places of interest.
                                                        
                                                    
                                                    
                                                        
                                                            These two days you will engrossed with interesting and delightful tour around Kathmandu and Patan cities. 
Morning starts with tour around Kathmandu, steeped with ancient heritage sites and monuments of both Hindu and Buddhist, morning after breakfast our tours starts with a short drive to Swayambhunath, a popular and famous pilgrimage sites for Buddhist and Hindu as well. 
An ancient Chaitiya of Asia and a major symbol of Nepal’s Buddhist heritage, Swayambhunath represents Primordial Buddha or Adi-Buddha. 
The hill top where Swayambhunath Chaitiya is built is called Padmagiri, Vajrakuta, Gosringa, Gopuchha, Samhegu, and Simbhu and listed as UNESCO World Heritage Site. 
Swayambhunath area offers grand views of whole Kathmandu valley with distant snow capped peaks.
After Swayambhunath visit Patan or Lalitpur City, which is close to Kathmandu and an adjoining city located south of Kathmandu on the other side of Bagmati River, an historical and cultural area with old palace buildings, artistic courtyard. 
After Patan tour leads to Bouddhanath, an important Buddhist pilgrimage and heritage sites in Nepal.  The story and history mentions that this Stupa contains relics of Buddha Kashyapa, with 176 miniature stupas and paintings of Tibetan Buddhist pantheons cover the walls that surround the Stupa at Bouddhanath. 
Bouddhanath Stupa is an important pilgrimage site for Tibetans which is mentioned in Tibetan classical texts such as Biography of Yeshe Tshogyal (A.D. 8-9) and Padma Ka’thang (A.D.14).

itinerary.title: Day 3
itinerary.description:
: Drive to Dhulikhel and visit Namodbuddha holy sites.
                                                        
                                                    
                                                    
                                                        
                                                            Located beyond the eastern rim of Kathmandu valley on the Tibet / China & Nepal Friendship Highway an hour drive where one can stay for overnight or more.
Dhulikhel at 1,440 meters, this beautiful spot offers panorama of High Mountain from Manaslu, Ganesh Himal in the far west to Langtang, Jugal Himal towards central north and as far to eastern horizon Gaurishankar, Melungatse Himal to Everest on clear fine day, Dhulikhel famous for Newari culture and popular as for resorts on route to Tibet and Jiri. 
Here with time in the afternoon visit to holy Namobuddha, which is near south of Dhulikhel just 20 minutes drive within pristine environment, a holy place for Buddhist, the old history belief is that Buddha on the path of learning-offered his own body without regret to a tigress suffering.
One of the unsurpassable supreme sacred sites known as the Three Stupas in Nepal is Tagmo Lüjin (lit "The place where the future Buddha sacrificed his body to a tigress"). It is the very sacred place where our teachers, the perfect and supreme Buddhafrom great hunger. What follows is a history of this supreme and distinguished sacred site, whose location is unmistaken based on the clear identification given in the Sutra Requested by the Tigress and so forth.

itinerary.title: Day 4
itinerary.description:
: Drive to Chitwan National park for jungle safari.
                                                        
                                                    
                                                    
                                                        
                                                            After breakfast an overland drive to low land of Nepal called Terai around warm semi-tropical areas, where deep dense jungles are located.
After a scenic driving past many villages and towns reaching at outskirt of Chitwan National Park where all nice hotels-lodge and resorts are placed, at Chitwan using the best hotels or resort for 2 overnight stops, after lunch a short introductory tour or nature walks with dinner accompanied by local Tharu culture dance programs.

itinerary.title: Day 5
itinerary.description:
: In Chitwan full jungle activities and elephant safari.
                                                        
                                                    
                                                    
                                                        
                                                            Full day jungle and nature programs starting early morning before breakfast with varieties of
activities includes elephant safari (morning or late afternoon) jungle / nature walks-bird watch tour, canoe ride to see crocodile and water birds, jungle drive with enjoyable elephant bathing and briefing, afternoon Jungle drive / Jungle or Nature walks or elephant safari (if not done earlier).

itinerary.title: Day 6
itinerary.description:
: Drive to Lumbini birth place of Lord Buddha
                                                        
                                                    
                                                    
                                                        
                                                            Lumbini “The Birth Place of Sakyamuni Buddha: (5 hrs drive from Chitwan)
Morning after an exciting time in Chitwan, then an interesting overland drive on the southern and west of Nepal to reach at Lumbini.
Located in South West Nepal, close to Indian border, Lumbini has a small airport, Lumbini meaning in Sanskrit for "the lovely" most important Buddhist pilgrimage site. 
Lumbini is the traditional birthplace of Gautama Buddha, the founder of Buddhism, who was born in the 7th or 6th century BC. On reaching at Rupendhi in Lumbini transfer to hotel close to Buddha’s birth place areas.

itinerary.title: Day 7
itinerary.description:
: Morning visit Lumbini holy sites and drive to Kathmandu.
                                                        
                                                    
                                                    
                                                        
                                                            Morning visit Maya Devi temple mother of Sakyamuni Buddha as the dates back 642 BC. 
In 249 BC, the Buddhist converted Emperor Ashoka of India, visited Lumbini and constructed four stupas and a stone pillar. Asoka’s Pillar bears an inscription that translates as: "King Piyadasi (Ashoka), beloved of devas, in the 20 year of the coronation, himself made a royal visit, Buddha Sakyamuni having been born here, a stone railing was built and a stone pillar erected to the Bhagavan ["blessed one"] having been born here. Lumbini village was taxed reduced and entitled to the eight parts (only)".
The site was rediscovered in 1895, when a German archaeologist came upon Asoka’s Pillar, identified by its inscription. Records made by the Chinese pilgrim Fa Xian were also used in the process of identifying this religiously acclaimed site. Lumbini was designated a UNESCO World Heritage Site in 1997.
After an interesting tour drive back to Kathmandu on the interesting highway taking more than 6-7 of exciting overland drive, on reaching Kathmandu transfer back to respective hotels.
(optional by air from Bhairawa airport to Kathmandu 45 mins of scenic flight)

itinerary.title: Day 8
itinerary.description:
: In Kathmandu free day for individual activities.
                                                        
                                                    
                                                    
                                                        
                                                            In Kathmandu free day to enjoy at leisure for own personal individual activities shopping souvenirs or can book for another interesting sightseeing tour around Kathmandu-Patan or Bhaktapur. We also arrange early mountain flight of one hour with views of Mt. Everest along with other chain of snowcapped peaks.

itinerary.title: Day 9
itinerary.description:
: International departure
                                                        
                                                    
                                                    
                                                        
                                                            Last day in unique Nepal after a memorable experience on “Cultural & Heritage Tour of Nepal” with great services of Guru Travels, and as per your international flight time, our staff transfers you to airport for the flight back home or to respective countries.

tours.title: Everest Base Camp Trek - 13 Nights 14 Days
tours.description: Embark on the ultimate Himalayan adventure to Everest Base Camp, following in the footsteps of legendary mountaineers. This iconic trek takes you through the heart of the Khumbu region, offering breathtaking views of the world's highest peaks including Mount Everest, Lhotse, and Ama Dablam. Experience Sherpa culture, visit ancient monasteries, and challenge yourself on this once-in-a-lifetime journey to the base of the world's tallest mountain.
highlights: Spectacular mountain views from Kala Patthar
Cross suspension bridges over deep gorges
inclusions: First aid kit and oxygen meter

activities.name: High Altitude Trekking
activities.description: Trek through diverse landscapes from subtropical forests to alpine terrain

activities.name: Cultural Immersion
activities.description: Experience Sherpa culture and visit Buddhist monasteries

activities.name: Mountain Photography
activities.description: Capture stunning views of world's highest peaks

activities.name: Wildlife Viewing
activities.description: Spot Himalayan wildlife in Sagarmatha National Park

itinerary.title: Arrival in Kathmandu (1,400m)
itinerary.description: Welcome to Nepal! Upon arrival at Tribhuvan International Airport, our representative will meet you and transfer you to your hotel in Kathmandu. After check-in, attend a pre-trek briefing where you'll meet your trekking guide and receive detailed information about the trek. Equipment check and final preparations. Evening welcome dinner featuring traditional Nepali cuisine. Overnight in Kathmandu.

itinerary.title: Fly to Lukla & Trek to Phakding (2,652m)
itinerary.description: Early morning flight to Lukla (2,800m), one of the world's most thrilling airports. The 35-minute scenic flight offers spectacular mountain views. Upon landing, meet your porter and begin the trek to Phakding. The trail descends through pine forests and crosses several suspension bridges over the Dudh Koshi River. Pass through small Sherpa villages and enjoy your first taste of mountain hospitality. Trek duration: 3-4 hours. Overnight in teahouse.

itinerary.title: Trek to Namche Bazaar (3,440m)
itinerary.description: Today's trek takes you to the famous Namche Bazaar, the gateway to Everest. Cross numerous suspension bridges including the spectacular Hillary Suspension Bridge. Enter Sagarmatha National Park and begin the steep ascent to Namche. The trail offers first glimpses of Mount Everest, Lhotse, and other peaks. Namche Bazaar is a bustling Sherpa town with shops, restaurants, and internet cafes. Trek duration: 5-6 hours. Overnight in teahouse.

itinerary.title: Acclimatization Day in Namche Bazaar
itinerary.description: Important acclimatization day to help your body adjust to altitude. Optional hike to Everest View Hotel (3,880m) for spectacular mountain panoramas including Mount Everest, Ama Dablam, and Lhotse. Visit the Sherpa Culture Museum and learn about mountaineering history. Explore Namche's colorful Saturday market (if timing permits). Alternative hike to Khumjung village to visit Hillary School and monastery. Rest and prepare for higher altitudes ahead.

itinerary.title: Trek to Tengboche (3,867m)
itinerary.description: Descend from Namche and cross the Dudh Koshi River. The trail contours around the mountainside with stunning views of Ama Dablam, one of the most beautiful peaks in the Himalayas. Gradual ascent through rhododendron forests leads to Tengboche, home to the region's largest monastery. Visit Tengboche Monastery and witness evening prayers if timing permits. Spectacular 360-degree mountain views including Everest, Nuptse, and Lhotse. Trek duration: 5-6 hours. Overnight in teahouse.

itinerary.title: Trek to Dingboche (4,410m)
itinerary.description: Descend through forests to Debuche and cross the Imja River. The trail gradually ascends through alpine meadows with incredible mountain views. Pass through Pangboche village, one of the highest permanent settlements in the world. Continue ascending to Dingboche, a summer settlement with stone-walled fields. The landscape becomes more barren and alpine. Spectacular views of Island Peak, Lhotse, and Ama Dablam. Trek duration: 5-6 hours. Overnight in teahouse.

itinerary.title: Acclimatization Day in Dingboche
itinerary.description: Another crucial acclimatization day. Optional hike to Nagarjun Hill (5,083m) for panoramic views of Makalu, Lhotse, Chalotse, Tawache, and Ama Dablam. Alternative hike to Chhukung village (4,730m) for closer views of Island Peak and Lhotse South Face. Rest day allows your body to produce more red blood cells and adjust to the thin air. Explore the village and interact with local Sherpa families. Prepare for the challenging days ahead.

itinerary.title: Trek to Lobuche (4,940m)
itinerary.description: Continue ascending through the alpine desert landscape. Pass the memorial site dedicated to climbers who lost their lives on Everest, including Scott Fischer and others. The trail becomes more challenging as oxygen levels decrease. Cross the terminal moraine of the Khumbu Glacier with views of Pumori and other peaks. Arrive at Lobuche, a small settlement in a dramatic setting surrounded by towering peaks. Trek duration: 5-6 hours. Overnight in teahouse.

itinerary.title: Trek to Everest Base Camp (5,364m) & Return to Gorak Shep (5,164m)
itinerary.description: The ultimate day! Early start for the trek to Everest Base Camp. Navigate through the Khumbu Glacier's rocky moraine with prayer flags marking the way. Reach Everest Base Camp, the staging point for Everest expeditions. Celebrate this incredible achievement with photos and take in the surreal landscape of ice seracs and glacial formations. Return to Gorak Shep for overnight stay. Trek duration: 7-8 hours. This is the highlight of your journey!

itinerary.title: Hike to Kala Patthar (5,545m) & Trek to Pheriche (4,371m)
itinerary.description: Pre-dawn start for the challenging climb to Kala Patthar, the best viewpoint for Mount Everest. Watch the sunrise illuminate the world's highest peak along with Nuptse, Changtse, and Lhotse. The panoramic views are absolutely breathtaking and worth every step of the challenging ascent. Descend to Gorak Shep for breakfast, then continue down to Pheriche. Trek duration: 6-7 hours. Overnight in teahouse.

itinerary.title: Trek to Namche Bazaar (3,440m)
itinerary.description: Long descent day retracing your steps through Pangboche and Tengboche. Cross the suspension bridge over Dudh Koshi River and ascend back to Namche Bazaar. Enjoy the thicker air and warmer temperatures as you descend. Celebrate your successful Everest Base Camp achievement with fellow trekkers. Last night in the mountains with hot showers and comfortable beds available. Trek duration: 6-7 hours. Overnight in teahouse.

itinerary.title: Trek to Lukla (2,800m)
itinerary.description: Final trekking day descending through familiar territory. Pass through Phakding and continue to Lukla. Reflect on your incredible journey and the memories created. Celebrate with your trekking team and enjoy a farewell dinner. Pack your bags and prepare for the flight back to Kathmandu tomorrow. Trek duration: 6-7 hours. Overnight in teahouse.

itinerary.title: Fly to Kathmandu
itinerary.description: Morning flight from Lukla to Kathmandu (weather permitting). Upon arrival, transfer to your hotel and enjoy a hot shower and comfortable bed. Afternoon free for shopping, spa treatments, or exploring Kathmandu. Evening celebration dinner with cultural show featuring traditional Nepali music and dance. Receive your trek completion certificate. Overnight in Kathmandu.

itinerary.title: Departure
itinerary.description: Final day in Nepal. Depending on your flight schedule, enjoy some last-minute shopping in Thamel or visit additional sights in Kathmandu. Our representative will assist with airport transfer. Depart with incredible memories of your Everest Base Camp adventure and a sense of accomplishment that will last a lifetime.

tours.fitness_requirements: Excellent physical fitness required. Regular cardio training and hiking experience recommended. Ability to walk 6-8 hours daily on rough terrain.

itinerary.title: Day 1

: Kathmandu Valley Sightseeing
                                                        
                                                    
                                                    
                                                        
                                                            Your tour begins with a warm welcome from your guide at your hotel, who will escort you to the Bouddhanath Stupa, one of the holiest sites for both Buddhists and Hindus. As you explore the vast stupa, you'll be surrounded by the hum of prayer wheels and the sight of pilgrims making their offerings. The iconic Buddha eyes watching over the square create a serene atmosphere. Next, you'll visit Pashupatinath Temple, an important Hindu temple dedicated to Lord Shiva. Located along the Bagmati River, it’s a powerful spiritual site where you can observe daily rituals and the sacred cremation ghats. Finally, your tour will take you to Bhaktapur Durbar Square, a UNESCO World Heritage Site filled with magnificent pagoda-style temples, the ornate 55-Window Palace, and vibrant market streets. Here, you’ll get a glimpse into the rich history and culture of Nepal, with beautiful architecture and bustling local life.

tours.title: Indo Nepal Cross Border Tour - 6 Nights 7 Days
tours.description: Experience the best of Nepal with this comprehensive cross-border tour covering Pokhara's natural beauty, Kathmandu's cultural heritage, and Chitwan's wildlife adventure. This unique journey starts from Gorakhpur, India, and takes you through the sacred birthplace of Lord Buddha in Lumbini, the serene lakes of Pokhara, the ancient temples of Kathmandu, and the wildlife paradise of Chitwan National Park.

activities.name: Cultural Tours
activities.description: Visit UNESCO World Heritage sites and ancient temples

activities.name: Wildlife Safari
activities.description: Jungle safari in Chitwan National Park

activities.name: Scenic Drives
activities.description: Beautiful mountain and valley views

itinerary.title: Arrival in Gorakhpur - Lumbini - Pokhara
itinerary.description: Arrive in Gorakhpur and meet our representative. Drive to Sunauli border crossing and complete immigration formalities. Visit Lumbini, the sacred birthplace of Lord Buddha, and explore the Maya Devi Temple and various international monasteries. Continue the scenic drive to Pokhara, Nepal's adventure capital. Check into hotel and enjoy the lakeside atmosphere. Evening at leisure to explore the vibrant Lakeside area.

itinerary.title: Sarangkot Excursion & Pokhara Sightseeing
itinerary.description: Early morning drive to Sarangkot viewpoint to witness the spectacular sunrise over the Annapurna and Dhaulagiri mountain ranges. Return to hotel for breakfast. Begin full-day Pokhara city tour visiting Bindavasini Temple, the mystical David Falls (Patale Chhango), and Gupteshwor Cave with its underground waterfall. Enjoy a peaceful boat ride on Phewa Lake and visit Tal Barahi Temple situated on an island in the middle of the lake. Evening free for shopping and relaxation.

itinerary.title: Pokhara to Kathmandu via Manakamana
itinerary.description: After breakfast, begin the scenic drive to Kathmandu. En route, stop at Kurintar and take the thrilling cable car ride to Manakamana Temple, dedicated to the Hindu goddess Bhagwati. The temple is believed to fulfill the wishes of devotees. Enjoy panoramic mountain views during the cable car journey. Continue drive to Kathmandu and check into hotel. Evening at leisure to explore Thamel, the tourist hub of Kathmandu.

itinerary.title: Kathmandu City Sightseeing
itinerary.description: Full day exploration of Kathmandu's UNESCO World Heritage sites. Begin with Pashupatinath Temple, the most sacred Hindu temple dedicated to Lord Shiva, located on the banks of the holy Bagmati River. Visit Jala Narayan Temple and then proceed to Swayambhunath Stupa (Monkey Temple), offering panoramic views of Kathmandu Valley. Continue to Boudhanath Stupa, one of the largest Buddhist stupas in the world and a center of Tibetan Buddhism. End the day at Kathmandu Durbar Square, the ancient royal palace complex with intricate wood carvings and the living goddess Kumari's residence.

itinerary.title: Kathmandu to Chitwan
itinerary.description: After breakfast, drive to Chitwan National Park, Nepal's first national park and a UNESCO World Heritage site. Upon arrival, check into jungle resort and enjoy welcome drinks. In the afternoon, visit a traditional Tharu village to learn about the indigenous culture and lifestyle of the Tharu people. Experience their unique architecture, customs, and way of life. In the evening, enjoy an authentic Tharu stick dance performance showcasing their rich cultural heritage. Dinner at the resort with traditional Tharu cuisine.

itinerary.title: Chitwan Safari Activities
itinerary.description: Full day of exciting jungle activities in Chitwan National Park. Begin with a canoe trip along the Rapti River to spot crocodiles, various bird species, and other wildlife. Visit the Elephant Breeding Center to learn about conservation efforts. Take a guided jungle walk with experienced naturalists to discover the park's diverse flora and fauna. The highlight of the day is the elephant or jeep safari through the dense jungle in search of the elusive one-horned rhinoceros, Bengal tigers, leopards, and various deer species. Evening at leisure at the resort.

itinerary.title: Chitwan to Gorakhpur Departure
itinerary.description: After breakfast and final moments in the jungle paradise, begin the drive back to Gorakhpur. En route, enjoy the changing landscapes from the Terai plains to the Indian border. Complete exit formalities at Sunauli border and continue to Gorakhpur. Transfer to railway station or airport for onward journey, carrying unforgettable memories of Nepal's cultural heritage, natural beauty, and wildlife encounters.

tours.fitness_requirements: Basic fitness level required for walking and light activities.

This 13-day overland journey from Kathmandu offers a transformative spiritual experience through the mystical landscapes of Tibet.

Spiritual journey through pristine Tibetan landscapes
Cultural immersion in Tibetan Buddhist traditions
Gamow bag for altitude sickness prevention

itinerary.description: Upon arrival at Kathmandu International Airport, you will be greeted and assisted by our representative after completing custom formalities. Transfer to hotel for check-in. Evening yatra briefing session before dinner covering important aspects of the Kailash Mansarovar Yatra.

itinerary.title: Kathmandu Temple Visit
itinerary.description: After breakfast, embark on Kathmandu city sightseeing tour. Visit Pashupatinath Temple, Boudhanath Stupa (World Heritage Site), Jal Narayan Temple (Sleeping Vishnu), and Kathmandu Durbar Square (Living God Kumari). Return to hotel for packing and preparation for the yatra.

itinerary.title: : Kathmandu - Drive to Kyirung(1600 m)
itinerary.description: Our representative will pick up you, drive to Kyirung(145 Km ,05/06 Hrs),arrive at Kyirung transfer to hotel for check in. Overnight at  Kyirung Guest house.

itinerary.title: Kyirung- Drive to  Gyirung County(2800m)
itinerary.description: After breakfast complete immigration and custom formalities in Nepal and China both side continue drive to Gyirung(35 Km ,1 Hrs 2800m). Arrive at Gyirung transfer to hotel for check in. overnight at Gyirung.

itinerary.title: Gyirung County Acclimatation(2800m)
itinerary.description: After breakfast you are free for visit around Gyirung county or shopping . Overnight at Gyirung County.

itinerary.title: Gyirung - Drive to Saga (4500M ,270 km 06/07 Hrs)
itinerary.description: After breakfast drive to Saga crossing Bramhaputra river(270 km, 6/7 Hrs),Arrive at Sanga transfer to hotel for check in. Overnight at Saga hotel.

itinerary.title: Saga - Drive to  Mansarovar (4550M ,470 km 08/09 Hrs)
itinerary.description: After breakfast drive towards Mansarovar lake (470 Km, 08/09 Hrs),Arrive at Mansarovar lake transfer to guest house for check in .Overnight at Mansarovar lake.

itinerary.title: Mansarovar Parikrama - Drive to Darchen (4600 m)
itinerary.description: After breakfast Parikrma of Mansarovar lake by vehicle (102 Km,3 Hrs) take Holy bath, Perform Puja(prayer ritual, Homa at Mansarovar lake, continue drive to Darchen (58 Km ,1.5 Hrs).Arrive at Darchen transfer to hotel for check in. overnight at Darchen.

itinerary.title: Darchen Darshan Yamdwar - Trek to Diraphuk (4860m, 12 Km - First Day of Kora )
itinerary.description: After breakfast short drive to Yamddwar, visit Yama Dwar.This is starting point of Kora.We will trek to Diraphuk which is 12 km trek (7/8 Hrs) crossing west face of Mt.Kailash,You will visit North face of Mt.Kailash. Arrive at Diraphuk transfer to hotel for check in. Overnight at Diraphuk. Overnight at a Hotel in Diraphuk.

itinerary.title: Diraphuk - Trek to Zutalphuk (4600M,22 Km - 2nd day of Kora)
itinerary.description: After breakfast trek to Dolma - La Pass and proceed to Zutalphuk(22 Km,12 hrs Trek). This is the most difficult journey throughout the the Yatra since you have to trek up to (5630m) height. From decent to Gaurikund and trek to Zutulphuk following river. Arrive at Zutalphuk transfer, check in to hotel. overnight at Zutalphuk at Huest house.

itinerary.title: Zutalphuk - Trek to Darchen(08 Km, 03 Hrs) - Drive to Saga (4500M - 3rd day of Kora)
itinerary.description: After breakfast short trek( 8 Km,2 Hrs) and reach to the point where our coach will be waiting and we will drive to Darchen and merge with other member who were waiting and drive to Saga. Arrive at saga transfer to hotel for check in.overnight at saga.

itinerary.title: Saga - Drive to Gyirung County(2800M ,270 Km,07 Hrs)
itinerary.description: After breakfast drive to Gyirung(270 km, 7 hrs). Arrive at Gyirung transfer to hotel for check in. Overnight at Gyirung

itinerary.title: Gyirung County  - Drive to Kathmandu  (1300 M, 200 Km 08 Hrs))
itinerary.description: After breakfast drive to Kathmandu crossing Nepal - China both side Border formalities continue drive to Kathmandu arrive at Kathmandu  transfer to hotel for check in.Overnight at Kathmandu.

itinerary.title: Kathmandu departure transfer
itinerary.description: After breakfast we will be provide appreciation certificate of Kailash Mansarovar Yatra later drop to airport for final departure

important_notes.health_requirements: Medical examination recommended before travel. Participants should be examined by a doctor to assess health condition and ability to cope with high altitude travel, extreme cold, dust, and trekking to 19,500ft during parikrama.
important_notes.altitude_sickness: Travelers are likely to experience altitude sickness symptoms (headache, loss of appetite, nausea, exhaustion, sleeplessness, breathlessness) until body adjusts. Mandatory 2 nights stay at Mansarovar (4550m) for acclimatization. Diamox tablets recommended. Gamow bag provided for altitude sickness prevention.
important_notes.currency: Chinese Yuan is the local currency. USD 1 = 7.02 Yuan & 1 Yuan = INR 11.90 approx. Money can be exchanged at Bank of China at Kyirung county.
what_to_bring: Thermal underwear, warm trousers & woolen shirts
Warm sweaters, woolen gloves, sun hat
Strong water bottle & water purifying tablets
Personal medical kit and Diamox tablets
Wet tissues and personal hygiene items
important_notes.risks_liability: All tours in Tibet are conducted under Tibet Tourism Bureau (TTB) rules and regulations. Company shall not be responsible for changes due to unavoidable circumstances such as landslide, road blockage, flood, snow, political unrest, flight cancellation, delays, sickness or accidents. Extra costs shall be borne by clients.

Holy bath and prayers at Lake Mansarovar
Reduced travel time with premium helicopter transfers

itinerary.title: Nepalgunj - Fly to Simikot (2800M,45 Minutes)
itinerary.description: After breakfast transfer to domestic airport ,fly to Simikot by arrive at Simikot airport, transfer to hotel for check in. Evening short walk to lord Shiva Temple back to hotel .Overnight at Simikot.

itinerary.title: Simikot - Fly to Hilsa by Helicopter - Drive to Purang (3700M ,35 Km ,1.5 Hrs)

itinerary.description: After breakfast short drive to Darchen, visit Yamdwar.This is starting point of Kora.We will trek to Diraphuk which is 12 km trek (7/8 Hrs) crossing west face of Mt.Kailash,You will visit North face of Mt.Kailash. Arrive at Diraphuk ,transfer to the Guest house for check-in.overnight at Diraphuk.

itinerary.description: After breakfast trek to Dolma -La Pass and trek to Zutalphuk(22 Km,9/10 hrs Trek).This is the most difficult journey throughout  the the yatra since you have to trek up to (5630m) height. From decent to Gaurikund and trek to Zutulphuk following river. Arrive at Zutalphuk transfer to the Guest house for check-in.overnight at Zutalphuk.

itinerary.title: Zutalphuk -Trek to Darchen(08 Km ,3 Hrs)-Drive to Hilsa  (3700m)
itinerary.description: After breakfast short trek ( 8 Km ,2 Hrs) and reach to the point where our coach will be waiting and we will drive to Darchen and merge with other member  who were waiting and drive to Hilsa.China-Nepal both side border formalities transfer to hotel for check in.Overnight at Hilsa.

itinerary.title: Hilsa - Fly to Simikot by Heli - Fly to Nepalgunj by Flight - Drive to Lucknow
itinerary.description: After breakfast fly to Simikot (20 Mins) by Helicopter, catch a flight from Simikot to Nepalgunj (50 mins) arrive at Nepalgunj transfer to hotel for fresh up later drive to Lucknow for final departure.

important_notes.health_requirements: Medical fitness certificate required. Consult your doctor about high altitude travel ability. Age limit: 18-70 years. Heart patients, pregnant women, and those with serious medical conditions should avoid this tour.
important_notes.altitude_sickness: Symptoms include headache, nausea, breathlessness, and exhaustion. Carry Diamox tablets. We provide Gamow bag for emergency treatment. Drink plenty of water and avoid alcohol/smoking.
important_notes.currency: Chinese Yuan (CNY). USD 1 = 7.02 Yuan approximately. Exchange money at Bank of China in Kyirung county. Exchange remaining Yuan before departure.
important_notes.fitness_requirements: Good physical fitness required for high altitude trekking. Regular walking/jogging recommended before the tour. Mental preparation for spiritual journey is equally important.
important_notes.weather_conditions: Weather can be unpredictable. Temperature ranges from -10°C to 15°C. Carry layered clothing. Monsoon season (July-August) may cause flight delays.
important_notes.helicopter_details: Helicopter flights are weather dependent. 15kg baggage limit per person. Flights may be delayed or cancelled due to weather conditions. Alternative arrangements will be made if necessary.
important_notes.risks_and_liability: Tours conducted under Tibet Tourism Bureau regulations. Company not responsible for changes due to natural disasters, political unrest, flight cancellations, or medical emergencies. Travel insurance mandatory.
